result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay W. Lloyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jay W. Lloyd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jay W. Lloyd was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:32 AM Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Jay W. Lloyd.  Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over record.   Atty Svehlek statement to court has a resolution and notes defendant has been transferred to DCI and asks for a new date for plea and sentencing.  Court sets over for plea and sentencing.  adj: 11:35 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jay W. Lloyd appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Jay W. Lloyd. Svehlek states needs more discussions with Defendant - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 01:57 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jay W. Lloyd appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Jay W. Lloyd. Svehlek states revocation hearing held and decision is not due to later this month - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 02:35 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:21 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jay W. Lloyd appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Jay W. Lloyd. Svehlek states Defendant is on a PO hold. Would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 03:23 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jay W. Lloyd appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Jay W. Lloyd. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Svehlek willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Svehlek states there is a PO hold. Bond continued. adj. 01:50 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jay W. Lloyd appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Court confirms Defendant's address. Does not have address - on a probation hold. Pfeifer statement to bail. Defendant statement to bond/residence/treatment. Court sets bond. adj. 01:44 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
